Description: Hufflepuff student in Harry Potter's year
Notes: [1] Prefect and member of Dumbledore's Army.[2] Married to Neville Longbottom.[1]B

Description: Head of the Department of Magical Games and Sports within the Ministry of Magic
Author of A History of Magic, and the great aunt of Gellert Grindelwald
Notes: Bathilda is a major source of information for Rita Skeeter's biography of Dumbledore, who extracts this information under the influence of Veritaserum; it is possible her memory is also modified following the "interview."[3]Hazel Douglas plays Bathilda in Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 1.

Description: Gryffindor Quidditch Chaser one year above Harry Potter
Notes: Member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: ghost, History of Magic professor
Great-great-grandfather of Sirius Black and former Hogwarts headmaster
Notes: His painting hangs in the office and assists the current headmaster.

Description: Brother of Sirius Black
Harry's godfather who was a close friend of Harry's father James
Notes: Escapee from Azkaban prison and member of the Order of the Phoenix. Killed in the Battle of the Department of Mysteries by his cousin Bellatrix Lestrange.

Description: Head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement, and the aunt of Susan Bones
Notes: Killed by Lord Voldemort.

Description: Hufflepuff student in Harry's year
Notes: Member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Ravenclaw student in Harry's year
Notes: Member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Gryffindor student in Harry's year and member of Dumbledore's Army
Slytherin student in Harry's year
Notes: Member of Dolores Umbridge's Inquisitorial Squad.

Description: Professor of Muggle Studies at Hogwarts
Notes: Killed by Lord Voldemort.

Description: Muggle gardener for the Riddle family
Notes: Killed by Lord Voldemort. Dumbledore states his belief in Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince that the murder of Bryce was used to create Voldemort's presumably sixth and intended final Horcrux, implanted in Nagini. However, Rowling later said Voldemort used the earlier murder of Bertha Jorkins for this.[4] Bryce is portrayed by Eric Sykes in the film adaptation of Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire.C

Description: Death Eater and sister of Amycus Carrow
Notes: Professor of Muggle Studies for one year, and Deputy Headmistress of Hogwarts under Severus Snape.

Description: Death Eater and brother of Alecto Carrow
Notes: Professor of Defence Against the Dark Arts for one year, and Deputy Headmaster of Hogwarts under Snape.

Description: Employee of the Magical Maintenance Department for the Ministry of Magic
Notes: Impersonated by Ron Weasley.

Description: Ravenclaw Quidditch Seeker one year above Harry, and his first love interest
Notes: Member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Ravenclaw prefect and girlfriend of Percy Weasley
Death Eater and father of Vincent Crabbe
Slytherin student in Harry's year and the son of a Death Eater
Notes: Slytherin Quidditch Beater and member of the Inquisitorial Squad. Killed by his own Fiendfyre spell. Jamie Waylett portrayed Crabbe in the first six films; due to Waylett's legal troubles, Crabbe was played by Blaise Zabini in the last film of the series.[5][6]

Description: Muggle-born Gryffindor student one year below Harry
Notes: Older brother of Dennis Creevey, and member of Dumbledore's Army. Killed during the Battle of Hogwarts.

Description: Muggle-born Gryffindor student three years below Harry
Notes: Younger brother of Colin Creevey, and member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Muggle-born Head of the Goblin Liaison Office, went on the run with fellow Muggle-borns Ted Tonks, Dean Thomas and goblins Gornuk and Griphook, during which he is killed
Head of the Department of International Magical Cooperation
Notes: Killed by his son Barty Crouch Jr.

Description: Death Eater credited with facilitating the return of Lord Voldemort
Notes: Used Polyjuice Potion to impersonate Alastor Moody, and received a Dementor's Kiss.D

Description: an Auror
Participant in the Triwizard Tournament as a representative of wizarding school Beauxbatons
Notes: Later married Bill Weasley.

Description: Fleur's younger sister
Notes: Rescued by Harry during the Triwizard Tournament.

Description: Member of the Order of the Phoenix who took the Dursleys into hiding
Cedric Diggory's father
Notes: Employee of the Department for the Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures.

Description: Hufflepuff student and prefect two years above Harry
Notes: Quidditch Seeker and captain, and co-winner of the Triwizard Tournament. Killed by Peter Pettigrew on Lord Voldemort's command.

Description: Dumbledor's predecessor as headmaster of Hogwarts, during which time Tom Riddle first opened the Chamber of Secrets
Notes: Expelled Rubeus Hagrid, who was framed by Riddle.

Description: A school friend of Albus Dumbledore
Death Eater who killed Fabian Prewett, Gideon Prewett, and Remus Lupin
Brother of Albus and Ariana Dumbledore
Notes: Owner of the Hog's Head tavern.

Description: Transfiguration professor in Tom Riddle's time, and Hogwarts headmaster in Harry Potter's time
Notes: Founder of the Order of the Phoenix. Killed by Severus Snape on Dumbledore's request.

Description: Sister of Albus and Aberforth Dumbledore, killed in a three-way duel between her brothers and Gellert Grindelwald
Wife of Percival Dumbledore
Notes: Mother of Albus, Aberforth, and Ariana Dumbledore.

Description: Husband of Kendra Dumbledore, father of Albus, Aberforth, and Ariana Dumbledore
Muggle son of Vernon Dursley and Petunia Evans, first cousin of Harry Potter
Notes: Rowling revealed on her website that many people have asked her to include an adult Dudley with a wizarding child in the epilogue of Deathly Hallows, and that she herself considered it, but decided upon reflection that any "latent wizarding genes would never survive contact with Uncle Vernon's DNA" and thus she did not do so. Rowling says that Harry and Dudley would "stay on Christmas card" terms for the rest of their lives,[7] and that Harry would take his family to visit Dudley's when they were in the neighbourhood, but it was something that James Sirius, Albus Severus and Lily Luna "would dread".[8] However, Dudley's kids and Harry's occasionally would "get together while the adults sat in awkward silence". In Harry Potter and the Cursed Child it is also mentioned that adult Dudley sent Harry his baby blanket, one of the two surviving possession of Harry's from his parents. Dudley is portrayed by Harry Melling in the Harry Potter films. Melling had to wear a fat suit, as he lost a considerable amount of weight as the films progressed.[9]

Description: Muggle sister of Vernon Dursley
Notes: Pam Ferris played Marge in the film adaptation of Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, in which she floats out of the house and into the sky after Harry inflates her.

Description: Harry's aunt, and his mother Lily's sister
Notes: Vernon's wife and Dudley's mother. In the film version of Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 1, she leaves Harry without showing any sentiment; however, in a deleted scene on the Blu-ray/DVD release, Petunia shows acknowledgment of the wizarding world, and ultimately deep sadness and remorse for the loss of her younger sister Lily, reminding Harry that she lost a sister as well.[10] Actress Fiona Shaw portrays Petunia in the films, with Ariella Paradise playing her as a child.

Description: Harry Potter's Muggle uncle
Notes: Petunia's husband and Dudley's father. Vernon is portrayed by Richard Griffiths in the films.E

Description: Ravenclaw student one year above Harry
Notes: Member of Dumbledore's Army who later betrays the group to Dolores Umbridge.F

Description: Squib neighbour of the Dursleys
Notes: Member of the Order of the Phoenix.

Description: Squib caretaker of Hogwarts
Muggle-born Hufflepuff student in Harry's year
Notes: Member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Gryffindor student in Harry's year
Notes: Member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Creator and owner of the Philosopher's Stone
Common thief and shifty Order of the Phoenix member
Head of Ravenclaw House and Charms professor at Hogwarts
Minister for Magic in the first five books
Notes: Sacked after persistently denying Lord Voldemort's return.G

Description: The pure-blood father of Merope and Morfin Gaunt, and grandfather of Tom Marvolo Riddle
Tom Riddle's mother who died in childbirth
Marvolo's son and Merope's brother
Notes: Framed by his nephew Tom Riddle for Muggle killings, and died in Azkaban.

Description: Ravenclaw student in Harry's year
Notes: Member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Death Eater and father of Gregory Goyle
Slytherin student in Harry's year
Notes: Slytherin Quidditch Beater and member of the Inquisitorial Squad. Joshua Herdman played Goyle.

Description: Muggle-born Gryffindor student in Harry's year and one of his best friends
Notes: Prefect and co-founder of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Hermione Granger's parents
Notes: During the Second Wizarding War, Hermione alters their memories, causing them to believe that they are called Wendell and Monica Wilkins, a childless couple who is moving to Australia, to protect them from Voldemort. After the War, she restores their true memories.[11]

Description: Draco Malfoy's wife
Notes: She died in 2019 due to her blood curse.[12] She is three years younger than Draco, and the younger sister of one of Draco's classmates from Slytherin. She is played by Jade Gordon in Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2.

Description: highly regarded Eastern European wandmaker
Werewolf working for the Death Eaters
Dark wizard who was jailed after Albus Dumbledore defeated him in the 1940s
Notes: Rowling claimed at a Q&A session that she implied Dumbledore being once in love with Grindelwald, and thus he had 'lost his moral compass,' but she did not say whether those feelings were returned.[13][14] In Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 1, young Grindelwald is portrayed by Jamie Campbell Bower[15] while the older Grindelwald is played by Michael Byrne. Grindelwald appears in the Fantastic Beasts film series, portrayed by Johnny Depp in the first two films.[16] In the film series storyline, Grindelwald and Dumbledore have made a blood pact in their youth to never harm each other which Grindelwald sports in a vial while seeking a means to indirectly kill his former lover. He first appears in Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them, though he is disguised for most of the story as the American Auror Percival Graves, played by Colin Farrell, while seeking out an Obscurus whom he learned to be Credence Barebone. In Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald, Grindelwald manages to manipulate both Credence and Queenie Goldstein to his side by promising the former he will tell him who he really is (supposedly Aurelius Dumbledore, a long lost brother to Albus and Aberforth) and the latter that she will be free to marry her No-Maj fiancé, Jacob Kowalski. Campbell Bower reprises his role as the teenaged version of the character in a brief flashback scene as well. In November 2020, Depp resigned from the role at the request of Warner Bros. due to his personal legal troubles.[17] Later that month, it was reported that Mads Mikkelsen was in early talks to replace Depp as Grindelwald for the third film.[18] On 25 November 2020, Warner Bros. officially announced that Mikkelsen would replace Depp.[19] On replacing Depp, Mikkelsen noted that it would be a "creative suicide" to copy Depp's "masterful" portrayal as Grindelwald, having developed his own take on the character, and admitted that a "bridge" should be needed between Depp's performance and his own,[20] having been a fan of Depp since his early films.[21]

Description: Substitute Care of Magical Creatures professor during Harry's fourth and fifth years
One of the four founders of Hogwarts
Notes: He was a very powerful wizard.H

Description: Half-giant Hogwarts gamekeeper, and Care of Magical Creatures professor starting in Harry's third year
Notes: Member of the Order of the Phoenix. As a Hogwarts student, he was expelled in his third year.

Description: Hogwarts flying instructor and Quidditch referee
Witch who works in the Ministry of Magic
Notes: Impersonated by Hermione Granger.

Description: Gryffindor student two years above Harry
Notes: Quidditch Chaser and later team captain.

Description: Gryffindor student two years above Harry
Notes: Hogwarts Quidditch commentator and good friend of Fred and George Weasley.

Description: Ministry of Magic employee that worked under the Department of Magical Games and Sports
Notes: Killed by Voldemort in order to create Nagini as the last horcrux.K

Description: Reformed Death Eater
Notes: Headmaster of wizarding school Durmstrang.

Description: Bulgarian Quidditch Seeker and Durmstrang student who participated in the Triwizard Tournament
Notes: Stanislav Ianevski portrayed Krum in the film adaptation of Goblet of Fire.

Description: Care of Magical Creatures teacher until Harry's third year
Notes: L

Description: Cousin of Sirius Black
Notes: Death Eater who tortured Neville Longbottom's parents Frank and Alice into insanity. Killed by Molly Weasley during the Battle of Hogwarts.

Description: Fraudulent celebrity author and Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher
Notes: Lost his memory after a memory charm backfired and resided in St. Mungo's afterwards.

Description: Neville Longbottom's parents
Notes: Aurors and members of the original Order of the Phoenix. Tortured into insanity by Bellatrix Lestrange.

Description: Frank's mother and Neville's grandmother, who raises him after his parents are incapacitated
Notes: Augusta is portrayed by Leila Hoffman in the first film, appearing only in the background escorting Neville to the Hogwarts Express.

Description: Gryffindor student in Harry's year
Notes: Member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Xenophilius Lovegood's daughter and Ravenclaw student one year below Harry
Notes: Member of Dumbledore's Army and wife of Newt Scamander's grandson Rolf.

Description: Luna's father
Notes: Editor of tabloid magazine The Quibbler. In Greek, his name means "one who likes that which is strange" (xeno meaning "strange" and philo meaning "liking" or "fondness").[22] Welsh actor and singer Rhys Ifans portrays Xenophilius in the film adaptation of Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 1.

Description: Lycanthropic Gryffindor student before Harry's time who befriended Sirius Black and James Potter
Notes: Professor of Defence Against the Dark Arts in Harry's third year, and member of the Order of the Phoenix. He and his wife Nymphadora Tonks gave birth to a son, Teddy, before dying in the Battle of Hogwarts.

Description: orphaned only son of Remus Lupin and Nymphadora Tonks and godson of Harry Potter
Notes: He is named after Tonks' late father, Ted Tonks, and his own father, Remus. Teddy is a Metamorphmagus like his mother Nymphadora, and is not affected by his father's lycanthropy.[23][24] He is mentioned in the final chapter of Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows by Harry, who says that Teddy "comes round to dinner about four times a week".M

Description: Death Eater and Committee of Disposal of Dangerous Creatures' executioner
Notes: Injured badly by Hagrid during the Battle of Hogwarts.

Description: Slytherin student in Harry's year
Notes: Quidditch Seeker, prefect, and member of the Inquisitorial Squad.

Description: Draco's father and an influential Death Eater
Notes: Governor of Hogwarts early in the series.

Description: Lucius' wife and Draco's mother
Notes: Sister of Bellatrix Lestrange and Andromeda Tonks. Narcissa is portrayed by Helen McCrory in the film series. McCrory was initially cast as Bellatrix Lestrange, but withdrew due to pregnancy; the role of Bellatrix went to Helena Bonham Carter.

Description: Son of Draco Malfoy and Astoria Greengrass
Notes: Sorted into Slytherin. Friends with Albus Potter. He is a kind-hearted boy who likes sweets and does not discriminate against non-pure-blood wizards.[12]

Description: Clothing shop owner in Diagon Alley
Governor of the Wizarding Examinations Authority which ran the O
Notes: W.L, N.E.W.T., and W.O.M.B.A.T. exams. Wizengamot elder.

Description: Half-giantess
Notes: Headmistress of Beauxbatons. Frances de la Tour appeared as Madame Maxime in Goblet of Fire, and reprised the role in Deathly Hallows.[25]

Description: Hufflepuff student in Harry's year
Notes: Prefect and member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Hogwarts Transfiguration professor, Head of Gryffindor House, Deputy Headmistress of Hogwarts, and member of the Order of the Phoenix
Notes: Assumes position of Hogwarts Headmaster for a time after Voldemort's death.

Description: Gryffindor student that accidentally removed her nose trying to get rid of her acne
Notes: Known for her bad case of acne.

Description: Gryffindor student one year above Harry Potter
Notes: Quidditch Keeper and member of Horace Slughorn's Slug Club. Freddie Stroma played McLaggen in Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 1 and Part 2.

Description: Slytherin Quidditch Chaser who became trapped inside a Vanishing Cabinet for a day
Retired Auror and member of the Order of the Phoenix
Notes: Impersonated by Barty Crouch Jr. in his scheme to enter Harry into the Triwizard Tournament. Killed by Voldemort.N

Description: Slytherin student in the same year as Harry Potter, and son of a Death Eater
Theodore Nott's father
Notes: Death Eater.O

Description: Leader of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement Squad in the 1920s
Notes: Turned the Gaunt family over to the Wizengamot for using magic in front of a Muggle. Died before Harry Potter's sixth year.

Description: Wandmaker and owner of the Ollivanders wand shop
Notes: Kidnapped by the Malfoy family for several months until freed by Harry, Ron, and Hermione. British actor John Hurt appeared as Ollivander in the film adaptation of Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone and reprised his role in Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 1 and Part 2. His first name was revealed in Pottermore. It was also revealed that he is married and has a son and a daughter (the latter deceased). Some of the names of his wandmaker ancestors were also revealed: Geraint Ollivander (ancestor), Gerbold Octavius Ollivander (paternal grandfather), Gervaise Ollivander (father).P

Description: Slytherin student in Harry's year
Notes: Prefect and member of the Inquisitorial Squad. Rowling said the character was based on real-life girls who teased her during her school days.[26]

Description: Ravenclaw student in Harry's year
Notes: Identical twin sister of Gryffindor student Parvati Patil, and a member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Gryffindor student in Harry's year and Padma's identical twin sister
Notes: Member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Death Eater and former school friend of James Potter, Sirius Black and Remus Lupin
Notes: Betrays Harry's parents James and Lily Potter to Voldemort, resulting in their deaths. Pettigrew is first introduced in the series as Ron Weasley's pet rat Scabbers. He is strangled to death by his own metal prosthetic hand after his loyalty towards Voldemort wavers upon Harry confronting him about having previously spared Pettigrew's life.

Description: Three brothers who were the original owners of the Elder Wand, the Resurrection Stone, and the Invisibility Cloak, respectively
Hogwarts librarian
Member of the Order of the Phoenix
Hogwarts school nurse
The main character of the series
Notes: Orphaned son of James and Lily Potter. Gryffindor student at Hogwarts, and co-founder and first leader of Dumbledore's Army. The husband of Ginny Weasley, father of James Sirius, Albus Severus and Lily Luna Potter.

Description: Harry Potter's father and member of the Order of the Phoenix
Notes: Killed along with his wife Lily by Lord Voldemort prior to the start of the series.

Description: Harry Potter's mother and member of the Order of the Phoenix
Notes: Killed by Lord Voldemort.

Description: Second child of Harry Potter and Ginny Weasley
Harry and Ginny's first child
Harry and Ginny's third child
Notes: Her name honours two women important to her parents—her paternal grandmother Lily Potter, and her parents' friend Luna Lovegood.[27] Lily is portrayed by Daphne de Beistegui in Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2.

Description: Defence Against the Dark Arts professor in Harry Potter's first year
Notes: Possessed by Lord Voldemort.R

Description: Daughter of house founder Rowena Ravenclaw
Notes: Stole and hid her mother's diadem, and became Ravenclaw's house ghost after being killed by the Bloody Baron.

Description: One of the four founders of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, and founder of the Ravenclaw house
The main antagonist of Harry Potter and the Cursed Child and daughter of Voldemort and Bellatrix Lestrange who tries to bring Voldemort back to life by completing a prophecy
Notes: Currently imprisoned in Azkaban.

Description: Muggle wife of Thomas Riddle, mother of Tom Riddle Sr
Notes: and grandmother of Tom Marvolo Riddle/Lord Voldemort. Killed by her grandson, Lord Voldemort.

Description: Muggle husband of Mary Riddle, father of Tom Riddle Sr
Notes: and grandfather of Tom Marvolo Riddle/Lord Voldemort. Killed by his grandson Lord Voldemort.

Description: Muggle son of Thomas and Mary Riddle, husband of Merope Gaunt and father of Tom Marvolo Riddle/Lord Voldemort Killed by his son, Lord Voldemort
Slytherin student who became Lord Voldemort
Gryffindor student and Quidditch Chaser
Death Eater and spy working in the Department of Mysteries
Death Eater
Ministry of Magic employee whose chief function was as an investigator of alleged Muggle-borns
Notes: S

Description: Magizoologist and author of Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
Notes: Main character in the Fantastic Beasts film series. Expelled Hogwarts student who excels in curing different sicknesses.

Description: Head of the Auror Office who replaces Cornelius Fudge as Minister for Magic
Notes: Killed by Death Eaters.

Description: Auror and member of the Order of the Phoenix
Notes: Replaces Pius Thicknesse as Minister for Magic.

Description: Conductor of the triple-decker Knight Bus
Notes: Jailed in Azkaban on suspicions of being a Death Eater. Stan was portrayed by Lee Ingleby in the film adaptation of Prisoner of Azkaban.

Description: Astronomy professor at Hogwarts
Reporter and tabloid journalist for the Daily Prophet
Notes: It has been speculated that the fraught relationship between Rowling and the press was the inspiration for the author to develop the character. However, Rowling noted in 2000 that the character actually predates her rise to fame.[28] Rita was intended to be in Philosopher's Stone, as Rowling revealed in an interview: "you know when Harry walks into the Leaky Cauldron for the first time and everyone says, "Mr. Potter you're back!", I wanted to put a journalist in there. She wasn't called Rita then but she was a woman. And then I thought, as I looked at the plot overall, I thought, that's not really where she fits best, she fits best in Four when Harry's supposed to come to terms with his fame".[29]Miranda Richardson appeared as Rita in the film adaptation of Goblet of Fire as well as in Deathly Hallows.[30]

Description: Former Hogwarts Potions professor and Head of Slytherin House, whose charges included Tom Riddle
Notes: Returned to Hogwarts to teach Potions in Harry's sixth year.

Description: One of the four founders of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, and founder of the Slytherin house
Hufflepuff Quidditch Chaser in Harry's year
Notes: Member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Potions and later Defence Against the Dark Arts professor at Hogwarts
Notes: Head of Slytherin House, and member of both the Death Eaters and the Order of the Phoenix as a double agent spying for Dumbledore.

Description: Gryffindor student two years above Harry
Notes: Quidditch Chaser and member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Hogwarts Herbology professor and Head of Hufflepuff House
Notes: T

Description: Minister for Magic while under the Imperius Curse
Notes: Replaced by Kingsley Shacklebolt.

Description: Gryffindor student in Harry's year
Notes: Member of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Sister of Bellatrix Lestrange and Narcissa Malfoy, and the mother of Nymphadora Tonks
Notes: Disowned by her family for marrying Muggle-born Ted Tonks.

Description: Ted and Andromeda's daughter
Notes: Auror and member of the Order of the Phoenix. She marries Remus Lupin and becomes the mother of a son, Teddy, before she and Remus are killed in the Battle of Hogwarts.

Description: Andromeda's Muggle-born husband, and the father of Nymphadora Tonks
Notes: Killed by Snatchers.

Description: Hogwarts Divination professor
Notes: Predicted the prophecy that prompted Lord Voldemort to go after the Potters.

Description: Hogwarts Apparition instructor who works in the Department of Magical Transportation
Notes: U

Description: Senior Undersecretary to the Minister for Magic, Hogwarts High Inquisitor and temporary Headmistress of Hogwarts
Notes: She becomes Defence Against the Dark Arts professor in Harry Potter's fifth year, and joins in the persecution of half-bloods and Muggle-borns under Voldemort. Sentenced to life imprisonment in Azkaban.V

Description: Member of the Order of the Phoenix
Notes: Killed by Death Eaters.

Description: Gryffindor student who unsuccessfully tries to romance Harry
Arithmancy professor at Hogwarts
The villain of the series
Notes: Murderer of Harry Potter's parents and many others in his quest for immortality and absolute power.W

Description: Muggle-born Ravenclaw student during Tom Riddle's time at Hogwarts
Notes: Killed by the Basilisk in a girls' bathroom, which she continued to haunt after her death. Tom Riddle used her death to create his first Horcrux: his diary.[4] Rowling revealed on her website that Myrtle was in Ravenclaw House[32] and that her full name was Myrtle Elizabeth Warren.[33] She added that the inspiration for the character was "the frequent presence of a crying girl in communal bathrooms, especially at the parties and discos of my youth."[34]Shirley Henderson plays Myrtle in the film versions of Chamber of Secrets and Goblet of Fire. The character was omitted from Half-Blood Prince.

Description: Muggle-obsessed Ministry of Magic employee, and member of the Order of the Phoenix
Notes: Husband of Molly Weasley, father of Bill, Charlie, Percy, Fred, George, Ron, and Ginny Weasley.

Description: Oldest son of Arthur and Molly Weasley, and Gringotts employee
Notes: Marries Fleur Delacour.

Description: Second son of Arthur and Molly Weasley
Notes: Member of the Order of the Phoenix. Works with dragons in Romania.

Description: Son of Arthur and Molly Weasley and identical twin brother of George Weasley
Notes: Gryffindor Quidditch Beater and member of Dumbledore's Army, later co-owner of joke shop Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. Killed in the Battle of Hogwarts.

Description: Son of Arthur and Molly Weasley and identical twin brother of Fred Weasley
Notes: Gryffindor Quidditch Beater and member of Dumbledore's Army. Co-owner of Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. Marries Angelina Johnson.

Description: Only daughter and youngest child of Arthur and Molly Weasley
Notes: Gryffindor student one year below Harry, Quidditch Seeker and Chaser, and member of Dumbledore's Army. Married to Harry Potter.

Character_Name: Hugo Granger-Weasley– Son of Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger, brother of Rose Weasley. Hugo is portrayed by Ryan Turner in Deathly Hallows
Description: Part 2
Wife of Arthur Weasley and mother of Bill, Charlie, Percy, Fred, George, Ron, and Ginny
Notes: Member of the Order of the Phoenix.

Description: Third son of Arthur and Molly Weasley
Notes: Gryffindor prefect and Head Boy, then Ministry of Magic employee, during which he becomes estranged from his family before joining them in fighting the Death Eaters in the Battle of Hogwarts.

Description: Youngest son of Arthur and Molly Weasley who is best friends with Harry Potter and Hermione Granger
Notes: Gryffindor Quidditch Keeper, prefect, and co-founder of Dumbledore's Army.

Description: Gryffindor Quidditch Keeper and captain four years above Harry
Notes: Oliver Wood was portrayed by Sean Biggerstaff in the first two films and once again in the eighth film.

Description: Daughter of Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger
Notes: Sister of Hugo Weasley. Rose is portrayed by Helena Barlow in Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2. She also featured in Harry Potter and the Cursed Child; she has been played in the West End production by Cherrelle Skeete and Helen Aluko.Y

Description: Death Eater
Notes: Head of Magical Law Enforcement under Voldemort's regime.Z

Description: Slytherin student in Harry's year
Notes: NA
